channel.title: Rosy faced lovebirds
channel.description:
so i recently got them, about $5 each so $10 for both.
i the breeder indicated that it was breeding in the nest, so i brought it home, and well it was quite, then it got out of the cage, finally caught it. now its starting to act weird, moving around all the time, making loud noises. first it started to strip paper, now it doesn't do that.
i haven't set up a nest in the cage yet, is it ready to lay eggs??
if any one have or had these parrots can you tell me their habits? i tried it on google no luck.

item.title: Rosy faced lovebirds
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“Ollie, post:7, topic:333545”]What! I would love to wake up in the Amazon!

Live like a mother fucking native, in the mother fucking forest![/quote]

There are fucking insects over there! I hate insects.

Read full topic

item.title: Rosy faced lovebirds
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

Really trippy thing, today my flatmate noticed a green parrot on a branch just outside his window. This is in a park in the middle of Manchester. It was there for a good 2-3 minutes just sat on a branch looking at us. It was doing that weird thing where they lift their food up in their legs and eat it from their claws heh.

Must have escaped from somewhere.

Read full topic

item.title: Rosy faced lovebirds
item.dc:creator: @SETO SETO
item.description:
@SETO wrote:

trying to tame the bird, i been attacked by the male twice (biting my gloved hand).

they would eat from my hands now, and one of them would (the female) stand on my hand.

getting a new cage today, better than the old one.

this is the one i’m getting about ~$35

item.title: Rosy faced lovebirds
item.dc:creator: @robocz033 robocz033
item.description:
@robocz033 wrote:

I have a bird of some sort… I think it’s a parakeet. Sometimes it’s really nice to hear them, other times its profoundly annoying. But they are sweet to look at, and my dog is obsessed with it. They’re pretty good pets, all in all.

item.title: Rosy faced lovebirds
item.dc:creator: @lordbost lordbost
item.description:
@lordbost wrote:

The Rosy-faced Lovebird has various harsh, shrieking calls.
en.wikipedia.org

Rosy-faced lovebird

The rosy-faced lovebird (Agapornis roseicollis), also known as the rosy-collared or peach-faced lovebird, is a species of lovebird native to arid regions in southwestern Africa such as the Namib Desert. A loud and constant chirper, these birds are very social animals and often congregate in small groups in the wild. They eat throughout the day and take frequent baths. Coloration can vary widely among populations. Plumage is identical in males and females. Lovebirds are renowned for their sleep ...

en.wikipedia.org

Rosy-faced lovebird

The rosy-faced lovebird (Agapornis roseicollis), also known as the rosy-collared or peach-faced lovebird, is a species of lovebird native to arid regions in southwestern Africa such as the Namib Desert. A loud and constant chirper, these birds are very social animals and often congregate in small groups in the wild. They eat throughout the day and take frequent baths. Coloration can vary widely among populations. Plumage is identical in males and females. Lovebirds are renowned for their sleep ...
